abstract: Microsoft challenges Nintendo with a new camera-based, motion-control game system and an improved Xbox 360 console.
snippet: Microsoft challenges Nintendo with a new camera-based, motion-control game system and an improved Xbox 360 console.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Looking to outdo Nintendo and its popular Wii, Microsoft on Monday officially introduced Kinect, its camera-based, motion-control game system. The company also announced that it had redesigned its Xbox 360 game console, making it smaller and quieter, and adding a built-in hard drive and Wi-Fi.

headline.main: To Rival Wii, Microsoft Unveils a Motion-Control Game System
headline.print_headline: To Rival Wii, Microsoft Unveils A Motion-Control Game System

abstract: Access to ESPN3 will be free for premium subscribers to Microsoft’s Xbox membership service.
snippet: Access to ESPN3 will be free for premium subscribers to Microsoft’s Xbox membership service.
lead_paragraph: In another content deal for a video game console, ESPN said Monday that it would stream thousands of sporting events to owners of Microsoft Xbox 360 consoles this year.

headline.main: An ESPN Channel to Stream Through Xbox 360 Console
headline.print_headline: An ESPN Channel to Stream Through Xbox 360 Console

abstract: TerraPower, a start-up company with a design for a nuclear reactor that extracts far more energy from uranium than do conventional ones has attracted a $35 million investment from venture capital firms.
snippet: TerraPower, a start-up company with a design for a nuclear reactor that extracts far more energy from uranium than do conventional ones has attracted a $35 million investment from venture capital firms.
lead_paragraph: A start-up company with a design for a nuclear reactor that extracts far more energy from uranium than do conventional ones has attracted a $35 million investment from venture capital firms, Matthew Wald reports in The New York Times.
